    • Method Detail

      • createClassificationJob

        public long createClassificationJob(String title,
                                    String instructions,
                                    String caption,
                                    List<List<String>> commonOptions,
                                    String commentCaption)
                             throws IOException
        Create a new entity classification job on CrowdFlower.
        Parameters:
        title - the job title
        instructions - the instructions
        caption - a caption for the answer form, which can include an {{entity}} placeholder which will be replaced by the text of the entity being classified (e.g. "choose the most appropriate description for {{entity}}")
        commonOptions - common options that should be presented for all tasks, in addition to the specific options for that task extracted from the entity annotation. This is expressed as a List of [value, description] two-element Lists, one for each option.
        commentCaption - caption for the free-text "comment" field, or null if no comment field should be shown.
        Returns:
        the newly created job ID.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • createClassificationUnit

        public long createClassificationUnit(long jobId,
                                     gate.Document doc,
                                     String asName,
                                     gate.Annotation context,
                                     gate.Annotation target)

        Create a single unit in a classification job for the given annotation. If the unit is created successfully, its ID will be stored as a Long valued feature named cf_unit on the target annotation.

        The target annotation must have a feature named "options" whose value is either a Collection of valid choices or a Map where each key represents one option value and the corresponding value is the human-readable description that will be displayed to the annotator (e.g. the key could be an ontology instance URI and the value its rdfs:label). The options will be added to the unit in the order they are delivered by the iterator, so if order is important you should use a collection or map with predictable iteration order, e.g. List or LinkedHashMap.

        If the target annotation has a feature named "correct" then it will be treated as a gold-standard unit. The "correct" feature must match one of the "options" (i.e. one of the keys if options is a Map) or one of the common options defined when the job was created - typically things like "none" (none of the available options is correct) or "nae" (the target is not an entity).

        If the target annotation has a feature named "leftContext", "rightContext" or "entity", these will be used to generate the entity text for display. Otherwise, the text will be taken from the document, as covered by the context and target annotations.

        Parameters:
        jobId - the CrowdFlower job ID
        doc - the document containing the annotation
        asName - the annotation set containing the target annotation
        context - the "context" annotation, i.e. and annotation covering the complete snippet of text (e.g. the sentence) within which the target entity will be highlighted in the unit. This need not live in the same annotation set as the target but must cover the target's span.
        target - the annotation representing the entity to be classified.
        Returns:
        the ID of the generated unit.

      • getJudgments

        public com.google.gson.JsonArray getJudgments(long jobId,
                                              long unitId)
        Get the list of judgments for the given unit. If there are no judgments, null is returned.
        Parameters:
        jobId - the CrowdFlower job identifier
        unitId - the unit identifier
        Returns:
        the "judgments" array for this unit, or null if none found.

      • createAnnotationJob

        public long createAnnotationJob(String title,
                                String instructions,
                                String caption,
                                String noEntitiesCaption,
                                String noEntitiesError,
                                String commentCaption)
                         throws IOException
        Create a named entity annotation job on CrowdFlower.
        Parameters:
        title - the job title
        instructions - the instructions
        caption - a caption for the answer form, which should include the entity type to be annotated.
        noEntitiesCaption - a caption for the "there are no entities" checkbox.
        noEntitiesError - the error message to show to the user if they have not marked any annotations but have also not ticked the checkbox.
        commentCaption - caption for the free-text "comment" field, or null if no comment field should be shown.
        Returns:
        the newly created job ID.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • createAnnotationUnit

        public long createAnnotationUnit(long jobId,
                                 gate.Document doc,
                                 String asName,
                                 gate.Annotation snippet,
                                 String detail,
                                 gate.AnnotationSet tokens,
                                 gate.AnnotationSet correctAnnotations,
                                 gate.AnnotationSet defaultAnnotations,
                                 String goldReason)
        Create a single unit for an entity annotation job.
        Parameters:
        jobId - the CrowdFlower job ID
        doc - the document containing the annotation
        asName - the annotation set containing the snippet annotation
        snippet - an annotation covering the snippet of text that will be presented for annotation, typically a Sentence or Tweet
        detail - additional details to be shown to the annotator below the snippet, e.g. a list of URL links that they might want to follow for more information. May be null, in which case no detail section will be added.
        tokens - annotations representing the individual substrings of the snippet that will be the atomic units of annotation. Typically these will be Token annotations. The supplied "tokens" should completely cover the non-whitespace content of the snippet, but need not cover all the intervening spaces.
        correctAnnotations - annotations representing the "correct" answer - if this parameter is not null then the unit will be considered as gold-standard data. This includes the case where an empty annotation set is provided, as this represents a gold snippet where the correct answer is that this snippet contains no entities.
        goldReason - for a gold-standard unit, the reason why the annotations should be considered correct. This will be shown to users as feedback if they get the gold unit wrong. Ignored for non-gold units.
        Returns:
        the ID of the newly-created unit.

        protected com.google.gson.JsonElement post(String uri,
